newsitem.title: USA: Heinz declines comment on pretax charge.
newsitem.headline: Heinz declines comment on pretax charge.

text.p: A spokeswoman for H.J. Heinz Co on Monday declined to comment on a Wall Street Journal report that said the food company will take a pretax charge of more than $500 million in its fiscal fourth quarter ending April 30.
The report also said Heinz will cut its 43,000-person workforce by six percent and sell ancillary businesses in the coming year that contribute $400 to $500 million in annual sales.
"We're not confirming anything at this point," the spokeswoman said. "We'll have more to say on Friday."

The company is scheduled to hold a previously announced meeting on Friday in San Francisco for analysts that will detail its expected restructuring plan. The company has been saying for several months that it plans to restructure but has not disclosed details.
